questions.neutral: You made it in one piece?

hobby.message: Freestyle FPV drones still keeping you sane?
Urban exploring with that homebrew again?

wrong_hobby_answer: That's not me. In free time, I fly FPV drones. It's a way to escape the noise of the city.
neutral_answer: Made it. Streets are louder tonight.
Dropped by after flying my drone. Just a short loop.
I keep things simple—don’t get in the way.
Guess everyone’s got to stay sharp lately.
Yeah, made it. Was at the glassworks earlier, flying my FPV drone.
Harder to find clear signals now; mesh noise everywhere since last week.
Had to pack up quick when some people approached.
You notice the city’s changed since those scores flipped?
I only fly when it feels safe.
I’m good. Was out flying drones at Sector 7 before this.
That’s my thing—FPV freestyle, in the old industrial zones.
Signal’s a mess with all these pop-up networks since the protocol crashed.
Someone wanted me to use the drone for message drops, can’t blame them.
The city’s tense, but flying clears my head.
Haven’t missed a weekend yet, even with the new restrictions.
Yeah, made it. Riskier now, but I still fly drones when I can.
Freestyle FPV in abandoned spots—best way to clear the static.
City’s buzzing since the BCI reversed scores—everyone’s acting different.
Mesh interference kills my signal now; too many hacked relays around.
Last run, people asked if I’d carry messages by drone. Never happened before.
Feels like the city’s looking for new backchannels.
It’s weird, but the drone is my one constant.
Made it in, just barely. Honestly, flying FPV drones is how I cope now.
Started before BCI, but after my brother vanished, it kept me grounded.
I hit the glassworks today. Used to be empty—now ex-flagged people gather there.
After the score reversals, they trust me more than the system does.
The mesh network’s full of noise, all these DIY comms, it’s killing my video link.
Some wanted me to pass handwritten notes on my drone—new kind of courier.
Strange, being trusted for this when my BCI tanks; feels upside down.
Sometimes I think the city’s rules barely touch the sky above the rubble.
hobby_answer: Yeah, still flying drones when I can.
Not much space left that feels safe now.
Crowds by the old factories make it harder to stay unnoticed.
Since the score reversals, even the air feels watched.
I keep it quick, low and quiet.
Yeah, I still do FPV. Sticking to the usual ruins.
A lot more people out there lately, not the usual types.
Signal interference's worse, everyone running something off-grid now.
Can't relax with the score flips—always checking who's watching.
Had to cut a session short this week. Not worth the risk.
Everything feels tighter since the BCI spill.
I fly whenever possible. FPV still clears my head faster than anything.
Old glassworks is my main spot, but lately it’s crowded.
The score reversal changed who hangs around. Lots of new faces, ex-flagged types.
Signal's a mess from rogue nodes. Drones nearly crashed twice this week.
People started using drones for drop points, actual paper notes.
Honestly, it’s not really escape anymore, just a different kind of surveillance.
Feels like no hobby is private now.
Yeah, drones are still my escape—at least, they used to be.
I go to abandoned industrials, mostly for clear signals and privacy.
Ever since the BCI mess, it’s like a flashmob out there. Everyone wants to hide or send messages.
Last week, some guy flagged me down, asked if my quad could drop notes.
Strange how my old hiding place is full of people who wouldn’t talk to me before.
I worry the score flips made us all paranoid, but nobody’s putting down their gear, either.
I keep my batteries charged just in case—I can’t give it up.
Feels like I’m carrying more than a drone now.
Definitely, drones are still my escape. Still feels better than any therapy ever did.
Started with repairs, then FPV racing, now it’s mostly flying to clear my head.
After the score turmoil, I’m seeing people I used to avoid out at the glassworks.
Funny, the ex-outcasts organize things, while old elites wander around lost.
Interference is getting worse. Mesh node noise, everyone hacking signals.
Last week, I helped someone with a physical note drop—never thought I’d do courier runs for strangers.
Feels risky, but like we’re building a network under their noses.
Sometimes I think my brother would’ve laughed at this—he always said I’d end up in the middle.
I know I’m being watched, but honestly, who isn’t now?
